name: Militech Security Team
description: Standard Militech corporate security. Professional, well-equipped, and trained to work as a unit. They follow protocol—which can be exploited.

weapons.name: Militech M221 Saratoga
weapons.notes: SMG, burst fire capable (+1 damage, -1 to hit)

weapons.name: Stun Baton
weapons.notes: Non-lethal option, target must save vs DC 12 or be stunned 1 round

abilities.name: Tactical Formation
abilities.description: When 2+ security are adjacent, they gain +1 Defense each. They naturally maintain formation.

abilities.name: Call for Backup
abilities.description: Can radio for reinforcements. 1d4 additional soldiers arrive in 3 rounds.

abilities.name: Suppressing Fire
abilities.description: Can forgo attack to pin down a target. Target has disadvantage on attacks and must succeed DC 12 REF check to move from cover.

behavior.tactics: Maintain formation, use cover, suppress and flank. One always stays back to call for backup if things go wrong. Prioritize protecting assets over killing intruders.
behavior.morale: Will fight until 2/3 of squad is down, then fall back to defensible position. Surrender if clearly outmatched and no backup is coming.
behavior.motivation: Paycheck. Following orders. Most are just doing a job—not zealots.

loot.item: Encrypted radio (can be hacked for patrol schedules)

notes:
Use this statblock for standard corporate security. For Arasaka, add +1 to all stats and better cyberware. For budget corps, reduce armor to 4.

Squad size: Typically 4-6 for patrol, 8-12 for response team.

They WILL call for backup. Silence them fast or be ready for escalation.
